title: Abdullah of Saudi Arabia - Wikipedia
snippet: Abdullah bin Abdulaziz Al Saud (1 August 1924 – 23 January 2015) was King and Prime Minister of Saudi Arabia from 1 August 2005 until his death in 2015. Prior to his accession, he was Crown Prince of Saudi Arabia from 13 June 1982.

title: A King's Biography | King Abdullah bin Abdulaziz Biography Center
snippet: Abdullah bin Abdulaziz bin Abdulrahman Al Saud: the sixth King of Saudi Arabia, and the tenth son of King Abdulaziz, he was born and educated in Riyadh, and was appointed head of the National Guard in 1963.

title: Abdullah of Saudi Arabia | King, Biography, History, & Facts | Britannica
snippet: Abdullah of Saudi Arabia (born c. 1923—died January 23, 2015, Riyadh, Saudi Arabia) was the king of Saudi Arabia from 2005 to 2015. As crown prince (1982–2005), he had served as the country’s de facto ruler following the 1995 stroke of ...

title: King Abdullah bin Abdulaziz al Saud Fast Facts | CNN
snippet: Saudi Arabia's King Abdullah — Saudi Arabia's King Abdullah bin Abdulaziz al Saud speaks at his private residence in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia, in June. The King has died, according to an announcement on Saudi state TV.

title: Abdullah bin Abdulaziz al-Saud
snippet: Abdullah bin Abdulaziz al-Saud became King of Saudi Arabia on August 1, 2005, when his half-brother King Fahd died.
